paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant associated with Indiana/Swiss hereditary amyloidosis, including penetrance data.

individual_records.phenotype_details: carpal tunnel syndrome, progressive peripheral neuropathy, vitreous deposits, and cardiomyopathy
individual_records.evidence_sentence: This disorder was originally described in a large Indiana family of Swiss descent and is also known as familial amyloidotic polyneuropathy (FAP) type II.

functional_data.summary: The variant creates an AluI recognition site, verified by Southern blot analysis.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, it segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is associated with a specific phenotype of hereditary amyloidosis.
key_quotes: We predicted that the corresponding mutation in the prealbumin gene consisted of a T-to-G change in codon 84.
This verifies the protein findings at the DNA level and provides a direct, reliable DNA test for the Ser-84 prealbumin gene associated with Indiana/Swiss hereditary amyloidosis.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
